text: SMT 2019 Calculus Tiebreaker March 2, 2019 Time limit: 15 minutes. Instructions: This tiebreaker contains 3 short answer questions. All answers must be expressed in simplest form unless speciﬁed otherwise. You will submit answers to the problem as you solve them, and may solve problems in any order. You will not be informed whether your answer is correct until the end of the tiebreaker. You may submit multiple times for any of the problems, but only the last submission for a given problem will be graded. The participant who correctly answers the most problems wins the tiebreaker, with ties broken by the time of the last correct submission. No calculators. 1. Deﬁne functions f0, f1, . . . , fn, . . . to satisfy the following relations: f0 = 2, d dx fn = fn−1. If for n ≥ 1, fn(0) = 0, compute ∞∑ n=0 fn(ln(2019)). 2. Compute lim x→0 x10ex sin 10(2x) . 3. Compute ∫ 10 0 ln(x7 + 1) dx + ∫ ln(10000001) 0 7√ex − 1 dx.
